      • loadUserByUsername

        public UserDetailsUser loadUserByUsername(java.lang.String emailOrPhone)
                                   throws org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException
        Specified by:
        loadUserByUsername in interface org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetailsService
        Parameters:
        emailOrPhone - The argument can be either User.email or User.<Set>phone. Method will try to find a User entity sequentially by email and phone.
        Returns:
        UserDetails containing User
        Throws:
        org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException - If a User entity wasn't found neither by email nor one of phones.

      • authenticateNewUserByUuid

        @Transactional(propagation=REQUIRED,
               isolation=SERIALIZABLE)
public UsernamePasswordUuidAuthenticationToken authenticateNewUserByUuid(UsernamePasswordUuidAuthenticationToken uuidAuthenticationToken)
                                                                                                                                                throws org.springframework.security.core.AuthenticationException
        1. Searches Uuid by the given String.

        2. Sets the derived Uuid#getUser() User.setIsEnabled(Boolean) to 'true'

        3. Sets all the default User#setExternalAuthorities(Set) for enabled Users.

        4. And deletes this Uuid as no longer needed.

        Parameters:
        uuidAuthenticationToken - UsernamePasswordUuidAuthenticationToken with UUID to be found
        Returns:
        Confirmed, enabled and ready to use User in the authenticated UsernamePasswordUuidAuthenticationToken
        Throws:
        org.springframework.security.core.AuthenticationException - If User from Uuid and from UsernamePasswordAuthenticationToken.getPrincipal() don't match; passwords don't match, Uuid is not valid or not found etc...

      • matchUuidUser

        private void matchUuidUser(Uuid uuid,
                           UsernamePasswordUuidAuthenticationToken uuidAuthToken)
                    throws UuidAuthenticationException
        Matches the User from the given UUID and the one from the given UsernamePasswordUuidAuthToken. Those Users must be the same.
        Throws:
        UuidAuthenticationException - If the derived Users are not equal. If the UUID is valid, UuidAuthenticationException#getValidUuid() will be 'true'.

      • matchPassword

        private void matchPassword(java.lang.String rawPassword,
                           java.lang.String encodedPassword)
        The raw password must match the encoded one from the User or Employee
